info.title: yente
info.description:
The yente API provides endpoints that help you determine if any of the people or
companies mentioned in your data are subject to international sanctions, known
to be involved in criminal activity, or if they are politically exposed people.

`yente` is the open source basis for the OpenSanctions SaaS API. Its matching
and entity retrieval functionality is identical to the hosted API, but it does
not include functionality for metered accounting of API requests.

In this service, there is support for the following operations:

* A simple text-based search for interactive applications (``/search``),
* A query-by-example endpoint for screening tasks (``/match``),
* Support for getting graph data for a particular entity (``/entities``),
* Support for the OpenRefine Reconciliation API (``/reconcile``).

The API uses JSON for data transfer and does not support authentication or access
control.

Further reading:

* [Self-hosted OpenSanctions](https://www.opensanctions.org/docs/self-hosted/)
* [Install and deployment](https://www.opensanctions.org/docs/yente/)
* Intro to the [entity data model](https://www.opensanctions.org/docs/entities/)
* Tutorial: [Using the matching API to do screening checks](https://www.opensanctions.org/docs/api/matching/)
* [Data dictionary](https://opensanctions.org/reference/)

parameters.name: exclude_entity_ids

schema.title: A list of entities IDs to exclude from matching
schema.description: The entity IDs supplied here do not have to be canonical. Supplying any of the referents of a merged entity will exclude that entity. This parameter may be useful for example to exclude false-positive matches that have been decided upon by a human.

parameters.description: The entity IDs supplied here do not have to be canonical. Supplying any of the referents of a merged entity will exclude that entity. This parameter may be useful for example to exclude false-positive matches that have been decided upon by a human.

get.description:
Search endpoint for matching entities based on a simple piece of text, e.g.
a name. This can be used to implement a simple, user-facing search. For proper
entity matching, the multi-property matching API should be used instead.

Search queries can include field-specific fitlers, wildcards and fuzzy searches.
See also: [search API documentation](https://www.opensanctions.org/docs/api/search/).

parameters.name: dataset

schema.description: Data source or collection name to scope the query to.
schema.title: Dataset

parameters.description: Data source or collection name to scope the query to.

schema.title: Query text
Types of entities that can match the search

parameters.name: include_dataset

schema.title: Restrict the search scope to datasets (that are in the given scope) to search entities within.
schema.description: Limit the results to entities that are part of at least one of the given datasets.

parameters.description: Limit the results to entities that are part of at least one of the given datasets.

schema.title: Remove specific datasets (that are in the given scope) from the search scope.
Remove the given types of entities from results
Search entities that were updated since the given date
Filter by country codes
Filter by entity topics (e.g. sanction, role.pep)
Filter by dataset names, for faceting use (respects operator choice).

parameters.name: filter

schema.title: Filter by entity properties (e.g. programId, birthDate)
schema.description: Use the syntax `field:value` to filter on a specific field. Properties are indexed as fields named `properties.birthDate:1985`.

parameters.description: Use the syntax `field:value` to filter on a specific field. Properties are indexed as fields named `properties.birthDate:1985`.

schema.title: Number of results to return
Start at result with given offset
Sorting criteria

parameters.name: target

schema.title: Include only targeted entities
schema.description: Please specify a list of topics of concern, instead.

parameters.description: Please specify a list of topics of concern, instead.

schema.title: Allow fuzzy query syntax
Use simple syntax for user-facing query boxes
Facet counts to include in response.

parameters.name: filter_op

schema.title: Define behaviour of multiple filters on one field
schema.description: Logic to use when combining multiple filters on the same field (topics, countries, datasets). Please specify AND for new integrations (to override a legacy default) and when building a faceted user interface.

parameters.description: Logic to use when combining multiple filters on the same field (topics, countries, datasets). Please specify AND for new integrations (to override a legacy default) and when building a faceted user interface.

get.description:
Retrieve a single entity by its ID. The entity will be returned in
full, with data from all datasets and with nested entities (adjacent
passport, sanction and associated entities) included. If the entity ID
has been merged into a different canonical entity, an HTTP redirect will
be triggered.

Intro: [entity data model](https://www.opensanctions.org/docs/entities/).

parameters.name: entity_id

schema.description: ID of the entity to retrieve
schema.title: Entity Id

parameters.description: ID of the entity to retrieve

schema.title: Include adjacent entities (e.g. addresses, family) in response

308.description: The entity was merged into another ID

get.description:
***Beta:** This endpoint is released for wider testing and is not yet recommended
for production use. We welcome feedback. Its interface may change without announcement.

Retrieve entities adjacent to a given entity e.g. passports, sanctions, associates.

This endpoint offers the same information as adjacent entities nested in
[`/entities/{entity_id}`](#tag/Data-access/operation/fetch_entity_entities__entity_id__get),
but offers pagination for cases where the number of results is potentially very large.

schema.title: Sorting criteria

Start at result with given offset

get.description:
***Beta:** This endpoint is released for wider testing and is not yet recommended
for production use. We welcome feedback. Its interface may change without announcement.

Retrieve entities adjacent to a given entity for a specific property.

This endpoint offers the same information as adjacent entities nested in
[`/entities/{entity_id}`](#tag/Data-access/operation/fetch_entity_entities__entity_id__get),
but offers pagination for cases where the number of results is potentially very large.

get.description:
Reconciliation API, emulates Google Refine API. This endpoint can be used
to bulk match entities against the system using an end-user application like
[OpenRefine](https://openrefine.org). The reconciliation API uses the same
search and matching functions as the matching API and will also produce
scores that reflect additional properties like country or date of birth, if
specified.

Tutorial: [Using OpenRefine to match entities in a spreadsheet](https://www.opensanctions.org/articles/2022-01-10-openrefine-reconciliation/).

parameters.name: dataset

schema.description: Data source or collection name to scope the query to.
schema.title: Dataset

parameters.description: Data source or collection name to scope the query to.

get.description:
No-op basic health check. This is used by cluster management systems like
Kubernetes to verify the service is responsive.

Search index health check. This is used to know if the service has completed
its index building.

Return the service manifest, which includes a list of all indexed datasets.

The manifest is the configuration file of the yente service. It specifies what
data sources are included, and how often they should be loaded.

Return a list of the supported matching/scoring algorithms used by the matching
endpoint.

See also the [scoring documentation](https://www.opensanctions.org/docs/api/scoring/).

post.description:
Force the index to be re-generated. Works only if the update token is provided
(serves as an API key, and can be set in the container environment).

schema.title: Update token for authentication
Wait until indexing is complete

ConfigVar.title: ConfigVar
ConfigVar.description: A configuration variable for a scoring algorithm.

ConfigVarType.title: ConfigVarType
ConfigVarType.description: The type of a configuration variable.

DataCoverage.title: DataCoverage
DataCoverage.description: Details on the temporal and geographic scope of a dataset.

DataPublisher.title: DataPublisher
DataPublisher.description: Publisher information, eg. the government authority.

DataResource.title: DataResource
DataResource.description: A downloadable resource that is part of a dataset.

schema.title: Schema

matcher.title: Matcher
matcher.description: Information about the matcher that was used to score this request. Deprecated, use `/algorithms` endpoint instead.

schema.title: Schema

FeatureDoc.title: FeatureDoc
FeatureDoc.description: Documentation for a particular feature in the matching API model.

FtResult.title: FtResult
FtResult.description: A explained score for a particular feature result.

schema.title: Schema

features.title: Features
features.description: A dictionary of subscores from features in the algorithm. Deprecated, use `explanations` instead.

explanations.title: Explanations
explanations.description: A dictionary of subscores from features in the algorithm and explanations for how they were calculated.

match.title: Match
match.description: Whether the score is above the match threshold.

tags.name: Matching
tags.description: Endpoints for conducting a user-facing entity search or matching a local data store against the given dataset.

tags.name: System information
tags.description: Service metadata endpoints for health checking and getting the application metadata to be used in client applications.

tags.name: Data access
tags.description: Endpoints for fetching data from the API, either related to individual entities, or for bulk data access in various forms.

tags.name: Reconciliation
tags.description: The Reconciliation Service provides four separate endpoints that work in concert to implement the data matching API used by OpenRefine, Wikidata and several other services and utilities.
